translated: The two varieties are the varieties of the three bodies and the varieties of the vajra.

original: de la sku gsum gyi de kho na nyid zlos pa las gong ma ltar rim gyis sam cig car du spro ba dang bsdu ba na nges pa med pa'o ;
analyzed: de la sku gsum gyi de kho na nyid zlos pa las gong ma ltar rim gyis sam cig car du spro ba dang bsdu ba na nges pa med pa'o ;
translated: There, in the repetition of the reality of the three bodies, the emanation and gathering are done gradually or instantaneously, as above, and there is no certainty.

original: / rdo rje ste ye shes sems dpa'i bzlas pa las cig car du bzlas pa 'di ni nges pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: / rdo rje ste ye shes sems dpa'i bzlas pa las cig car du bzlas pa 'di ni nges pa kho na yin no //
translated: The vajra is the wisdom-being recitation. Uninterrupted means that this recitation is definitely done at the same time.

original: mchod pa spro ba na yang rang rang gi rigs kyi lha mos mchod pa byed kyi gzhan gyi rigs kyis ma yin par gsungs pa /
analyzed: mchod pa spro ba na yang rang rang gi rigs kyi lha mos mchod pa byed kyi gzhan gyi rigs kyis ma yin par gsungs pa /
translated: When emanating offerings, it is said that the goddesses of one's own family make offerings, not those of other families.

original: sku la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sku la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The body and so forth are as follows.

original: sku la zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la'o //
analyzed: sku la zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la'o //
translated: The body is Vairochana.

original: sku'i dngos po nyid ces pa ni de'i rang bzhin gyis zin pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sku'i dngos po nyid ces pa ni de'i rang bzhin gyis zin pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of the body is Lochana and so forth, which are possessed of his nature.

original: de bzhin du thugs la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o /
analyzed: de bzhin du thugs la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o /
translated: The mind and so forth are to be applied in the same way.

original: lha mo de rnams kyang spro ba'i dus su dbu rgyan dang ldan par spro ba'o //
analyzed: lha mo de rnams kyang spro ba'i dus su dbu rgyan dang ldan par spro ba'o //
translated: Those goddesses, when emanating, are emanated with crowns.

original: de bzhin du ye shes kyi rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas pas na 'jug pa la sogs pa rung gi /
analyzed: de bzhin du ye shes kyi rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas pas na 'jug pa la sogs pa rung gi /
translated: Likewise, in terms of the purity of wisdom, the entry and so forth are suitable.

original: des bde ba mchog gi rkyen du gyur pa'i phyir rang gi lha mo la thim pa'o //
analyzed: des bde ba mchog gi rkyen du gyur pa'i phyir rang gi lha mo la thim pa'o //
translated: Since they are the condition for supreme bliss, they dissolve into one's own goddess.

original: sa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas pas na phyi'i mchod pa yang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas pas na phyi'i mchod pa yang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Since it is in terms of the purification of the earth and so forth, the external offerings are not contradictory.

original: de ltar mchod na gnas dang 'brel pa nyid du 'gyur @65a * //
analyzed: de ltar mchod na gnas dang 'brel pa nyid du 'gyur @65a * //
translated: If one makes offerings in this way, one will be connected with the place,

original: bas na mchod pa'i gnas su 'gyur zhes so //
analyzed: bas na mchod pa'i gnas su 'gyur zhes so //
translated: and so one will become a fit recipient for offerings.

original: da ni las khyad par can rnams dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la gnas te sgrub pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni las khyad par can rnams dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la gnas te sgrub pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the special activities are taught to be accomplished by abiding in the maṇḍala wheel.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po'i 'khor lo zhes pa ni lha bcu dgu dang ldan par ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po'i 'khor lo zhes pa ni lha bcu dgu dang ldan par ro //
translated: The “great maṇḍala wheel” is endowed with the nineteen deities.

original: rdo rje lnga rnams zhes pa ni bde bar gshegs pa rnams dang / de'i rigs rnams bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: rdo rje lnga rnams zhes pa ni bde bar gshegs pa rnams dang / de'i rigs rnams bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
translated: The “five vajras” are the sugatas and their families, which should be meditated on.

original: de'i dbus su bdag po las kyi bye brag gis gang yang rung ba bsams nas de yang rdo rje gsum dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin pas na /
analyzed: de'i dbus su bdag po las kyi bye brag gis gang yang rung ba bsams nas de yang rdo rje gsum dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin pas na /
translated: Having visualized any one of them in the center by the particularity of the lord’s activity, since that also has the nature of the three vajras,

original: sku gsum rdo rje dag gi gzugs //
analyzed: sku gsum rdo rje dag gi gzugs //
translated: the form of the three vajra bodies

original: zhes te dkar po la sogs pa kha dog dang ; rig pa dang ldan pa'i sngags dang / ye shes dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'i sbyor bas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes te dkar po la sogs pa kha dog dang ; rig pa dang ldan pa'i sngags dang / ye shes dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'i sbyor bas bsdus pa'o //
translated: Thus, white and so on are the colors, and the mantra endowed with awareness, and the mental orientation endowed with intuition, are the applications.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He states just that:🔽The forms of the vajra of one's mantra

original: rang sngags rdo rje'i gzugs dag ni //
analyzed: rang sngags rdo rje'i gzugs dag ni //
translated: And the forms of the vajra of one’s mantra🔽

original: zhes te rang gi sngags las skyes pa'i 'khor lo'i gzugs bsgoms nas rtag pa la sogs par dkyil 'khor rnam pa bzhi dag dang / dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog rnam pa bzhir brtags la bdag po'i snying gar ye shes sems dpa' dang / sngags aom la sogs pa'i don bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: zhes te rang gi sngags las skyes pa'i 'khor lo'i gzugs bsgoms nas rtag pa la sogs par dkyil 'khor rnam pa bzhi dag dang / dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog rnam pa bzhir brtags la bdag po'i snying gar ye shes sems dpa' dang / sngags aom la sogs pa'i don bsgom pa ste /
translated: Having contemplated the form of the wheel born from one's mantra, one should always imagine the four kinds of mandalas, such as the white one, and so on, as the four colors, white and so on, and contemplate the meaning of the mantra, such as Om and so on, as the intuition being in the heart of the lord.

original: 'dod pa snying gar gzhag pa la sogs pa byas pas zhi ba la sogs pa rdo rje rnam pa bzhi'i rnal 'byor pa bsam gtan rdo rje la gnas pas byed ces so //🔽gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pas na /
analyzed: 'dod pa snying gar gzhag pa la sogs pa byas pas zhi ba la sogs pa rdo rje rnam pa bzhi'i rnal 'byor pa bsam gtan rdo rje la gnas pas byed ces so // gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pas na /
translated: By doing such things as placing the desire in the heart, the yogin of the four kinds of vajra, such as the pacifying one, and so on, abiding in the vajra of contemplation, should do it.🔽Since it is not common to others, it is the secret.

original: gsang ba rab tu bzang po yin //
analyzed: gsang ba rab tu bzang po yin //
translated: It is the excellent secret.

original: zhes so // da ni lhag pa'i mthu dang ldan pas skye bo'i bsam pa'i dbang gis las so so'i nges pa bstan pa'i bkra shis pa'i lha bzhi gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // da ni lhag pa'i mthu dang ldan pas skye bo'i bsam pa'i dbang gis las so so'i nges pa bstan pa'i bkra shis pa'i lha bzhi gsungs pa /
translated: Now, by the power of the superior might, the four auspicious deities are taught, which are the ascertainment of the individual actions by the power of the intention of beings.

original: zhi ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [He] says, peace, etc.

original: spyan gyi tshul zhes pa ni de'i bdag po ste dkar po bsam pa'o //
analyzed: spyan gyi tshul zhes pa ni de'i bdag po ste dkar po bsam pa'o //
translated: The method of the eye is the lord of that, the white intention.

original: rdo rje pad can ni snang ba mtha' yas te rgyas pa la ser por bsam pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje pad can ni snang ba mtha' yas te rgyas pa la ser por bsam pa'o //
translated: The vajra lotus is Amitābha, and for increase, one should imagine the yellow.

original: rnam par snang mdzad gnas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad gnas zhes pa ni /
translated: The abode of Vairocana

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi gnas su las gzhan la don yod grub pa'i dmar por bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi gnas su las gzhan la don yod grub pa'i dmar por bsam par bya'o //
translated: is the abode of Vairocana, and for other actions, one should imagine Amoghasiddhi as red.

original: rdo rje khro bo zhes pa ni rdo rje rigs rnam par khro ba ste mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khro bo zhes pa ni rdo rje rigs rnam par khro ba ste mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The vajra wrath is the vajra family in a wrathful form, which is Akṣobhya.

original: gsang ba sku gsum zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba sku gsum zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The secret three bodies is Vajradhara.

original: de las byung ba ni sngags rnams kun gyi sprul pa ste /
analyzed: de las byung ba ni sngags rnams kun gyi sprul pa ste /
translated: Arisen from that is the emanation of all mantras,

original: 'gro ba'i don du las bzhi spros @65b pa'o ;
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don du las bzhi spros @65b pa'o ;
translated: which is the proliferation of the four actions for the benefit of beings.

original: / de'i don du spyod pa nyid rol mo ste des rgyas btab pa'i phyir na mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: / de'i don du spyod pa nyid rol mo ste des rgyas btab pa'i phyir na mtshan ma'o //
translated: The play itself is the enjoyment of that, and the seal is the sign of that.

original: da ni mngon spyod kyi yul gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni mngon spyod kyi yul gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the object of the rite of assault is stated:

original: ma dad ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma dad ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: faithless and so forth.

original: ma dad pa ni byang chub kyi sems la'o //
analyzed: ma dad pa ni byang chub kyi sems la'o //
translated: Faithless means faithless in the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: smra ba'o zhes pa ni dkon mchog gsum la log par smra ba'o//
analyzed: smra ba'o zhes pa ni dkon mchog gsum la log par smra ba'o//
translated: Slanderer means one who speaks ill of the Three Jewels.

original: rdo rje slob dpon smod pa zhes pa ni bla ma la sgo gsum gyis gnod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon smod pa zhes pa ni bla ma la sgo gsum gyis gnod pa byed pa'o //
translated: Despiser of the Vajra Master means one who harms the guru with the three doors.

original: gdug pa'i sems can gzhan zhes pa ni pha gsod pa la sogs pa lam log par ltung bar nges pa la 'og nas 'byung ba'i bar du bskul ba 'di bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: gdug pa'i sems can gzhan zhes pa ni pha gsod pa la sogs pa lam log par ltung bar nges pa la 'og nas 'byung ba'i bar du bskul ba 'di bya'o zhes so //
translated: Other evil beings means one who is certain to fall into the wrong path, such as a patricide, and so forth.

original: ye shes chen po ni gong ma ltar ro //
analyzed: ye shes chen po ni gong ma ltar ro //
translated: Great wisdom is as above.

original: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: Vajra is the Tathagata.

original: de rnams kyang 'khor lo dang ldan bas na 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang 'khor lo dang ldan bas na 'khor lo'o //
translated: Wheel is the wheel of those.

original: dri ma dang ldan pa'i yul de'i kha sbyor 'byed pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: dri ma dang ldan pa'i yul de'i kha sbyor 'byed pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: The procedure for separating the union of that object which possesses stains is stated:

original: khams gsum zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three realms and so forth.

original: khams gsum gang ba'i sems can rnams 'og nas 'byung ba ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i skur bsgoms la gzhan 'og nas 'byung ba ltar bya'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gang ba'i sems can rnams 'og nas 'byung ba ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i skur bsgoms la gzhan 'og nas 'byung ba ltar bya'o //
translated: Having meditated on the sentient beings filling the three realms as the bodies of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, as will be described below, one should do the rest as will be described below.

original: de nas / dgra rnams dbye ba byas nas su //
analyzed: de nas / dgra rnams dbye ba byas nas su //
translated: Then, having divided the enemies,

original: zhes te khyad par dang thun mong gi srung ma dang 'og nas 'byung ba ltar dbye ba byas la de khang stong ltar rnam par gnas pa de la 'og nas 'byung ba ltar las rnams rab tu bsgrub ces pa'o //
analyzed: zhes te khyad par dang thun mong gi srung ma dang 'og nas 'byung ba ltar dbye ba byas la de khang stong ltar rnam par gnas pa de la 'og nas 'byung ba ltar las rnams rab tu bsgrub ces pa'o //
translated: one should divide the special and common guardians, as will be described below, and in that place, which is like an empty house, one should accomplish the rites, as will be described below.

original: da ni mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas mngon spyod kyi cho ga bsam gtan las byung ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas mngon spyod kyi cho ga bsam gtan las byung ba gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the procedure of the rite of assault by the yoga of Akshobhya, which arises from contemplation, is stated:

original: nam mkha'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The space and so forth.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings ni chos kyi 'byung gnas nad gzhal yas khang brtsegs pa'i dbus dag tu zhes so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings ni chos kyi 'byung gnas nad gzhal yas khang brtsegs pa'i dbus dag tu zhes so //
translated: In the middle of the celestial mansion of the Dharma source, the realm of space, in the middle and so forth.

original: rdo rje rtse lnga kha bzhis zhes pa ni rtse gcig la phyogs bzhir gdengs ka'i rtse mor ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse lnga kha bzhis zhes pa ni rtse gcig la phyogs bzhir gdengs ka'i rtse mor ldan pa'o //
translated: The five-pronged vajra with four prongs means that the single prong has four prongs on its sides.

original: 'dir sna tshogs rdo rje la mi sbyar gyi /
analyzed: 'dir sna tshogs rdo rje la mi sbyar gyi /
translated: Here, one should not apply the variegated vajra,

original: de'i byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the agent.

original: rnam pa'i mchog rnams ni mtshan dang dpe byad du ldan pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' bsgom zhes te /
analyzed: rnam pa'i mchog rnams ni mtshan dang dpe byad du ldan pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' bsgom zhes te /
translated: The supreme aspects are the vajrasattva endowed with the major and minor marks.

original: sngar dang po'i mgon po las gyur pa'i sa bon las ji skad du gsungs pa'i rdo rje sa bon dang ldan par bsgoms te /
analyzed: sngar dang po'i mgon po las gyur pa'i sa bon las ji skad du gsungs pa'i rdo rje sa bon dang ldan par bsgoms te /
translated: From the seed previously arisen from the first lord, one should meditate on the seed endowed with the vajra seed as described.

original: de'i 'od zer gyis bde bar gshegs pa la bsgrub bya'i skyon brjod pas thams cad mi bskyod pa khros nas slar bsdus te thim pa las @66a * //
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyis bde bar gshegs pa la bsgrub bya'i skyon brjod pas thams cad mi bskyod pa khros nas slar bsdus te thim pa las @66a * //
translated: By the light rays of that, the well-gone ones are requested to remove the faults of the one to be accomplished. All of them become angry Akshobhya, and having gathered back, dissolve.

original: gyur pa'i mi bskyod pa shin tu khros par bsgom mo //
analyzed: gyur pa'i mi bskyod pa shin tu khros par bsgom mo //
translated: From that, one should meditate on Akshobhya arisen from the seed, very angry.

original: dus gsum dam tshig ni chog dang po 'grub pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: dus gsum dam tshig ni chog dang po 'grub pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The pledge of the three times is the cause of accomplishing the first rite.

original: de las byung ba'i chog la sogs pas /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i chog la sogs pas /
translated: From that, the rite and so forth arise.

original: sangs rgyas 'khor lo rnam bsgoms la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'khor lo rnam bsgoms la //
translated: One should meditate on the wheel of the buddhas.

original: zhes te rtag pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du rnam par bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: zhes te rtag pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du rnam par bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
translated: Thus, one should meditate on permanence and so forth in the same way.

original: sangs rgyas 'khor lo zhes pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma gong du gsungs pa mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i drag po mi bskyod pa de'i lag pa g-yas par gzung bar bya zhes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'khor lo zhes pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan ma gong du gsungs pa mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i drag po mi bskyod pa de'i lag pa g-yas par gzung bar bya zhes so //
translated: The “wheel of the Buddha” is the sign of the nature of all the Buddhas, which was mentioned above, and it is the great power of Rudra Akṣobhya. One should hold it in one’s right hand.

original: de bzhin du phyag mtshan gzhan rnams kyang bzang bar bsams nas ;
analyzed: de bzhin du phyag mtshan gzhan rnams kyang bzang bar bsams nas ;
translated: In the same way, one should imagine the other hand implements as well.

original: de nas phyogs bcu nas byung ba'i sems can ji snyed pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi sku zhi ba'i bye brag gis bsdus nas 'od kyi gong bu'i tshul du rang gi sku gsum ste lus ngag yid gsum la gzung ngo zhes so //
analyzed: de nas phyogs bcu nas byung ba'i sems can ji snyed pa rnams sangs rgyas kyi sku zhi ba'i bye brag gis bsdus nas 'od kyi gong bu'i tshul du rang gi sku gsum ste lus ngag yid gsum la gzung ngo zhes so //
translated: Then, all the sentient beings that exist in the ten directions are gathered by the special peace of the body of the Buddha, and they are held in one’s own three bodies, that is, in one’s body, speech, and mind, in the manner of a ball of light.

original: de nas aom a'a: badzra dhrik che ge mo m'a ra ya phat h'um zhes brjod pas sangs rgyas ye shes rdo rje can rnams rang gi lus las slar yang spro bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de nas aom a'a: badzra dhrik che ge mo m'a ra ya phat h'um zhes brjod pas sangs rgyas ye shes rdo rje can rnams rang gi lus las slar yang spro bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: Then, saying OṂ ĀḤ Vajra-DṚIK Causing So-and-so to die PHAṬ HŪṂ, one should emit again from one’s body the Buddhas who are the vajra-holders of pristine awareness.

original: ji lta bu'i gzugs su spro zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i gzugs su spro zhe na /
translated: In what form does one emit them?

original: khro bas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khro bas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [The Bhagavān] says, “angry,” and so on.

original: de yang sems khro bas 'khrugs pa'i khro bo shin tu mi sdug cing 'jigs su rung ba srin po la sogs pa'i gzugs sta re dang tho ba la sogs pa mtshon cha sna tshogs 'dzin pa /
analyzed: de yang sems khro bas 'khrugs pa'i khro bo shin tu mi sdug cing 'jigs su rung ba srin po la sogs pa'i gzugs sta re dang tho ba la sogs pa mtshon cha sna tshogs 'dzin pa /
translated: Moreover, one should emit them in various forms, angry because the mind is disturbed, very ugly and terrifying, in the form of a rākṣasa, and so on, holding various weapons such as an axe and a hammer,

original: gsod pa'i don 'ba' zhig sems pa gang gsod na dkon mchog la gnod pa la sogs pa'i gdug pa rnams gsod pa dang / gdug par gyur na rdo rje sems dpa' yang gsod pa'i gzugs sna tshogs par spros nas 'og nas 'byung ba ltar bya'o zhes pa ni man ngag go //
analyzed: gsod pa'i don 'ba' zhig sems pa gang gsod na dkon mchog la gnod pa la sogs pa'i gdug pa rnams gsod pa dang / gdug par gyur na rdo rje sems dpa' yang gsod pa'i gzugs sna tshogs par spros nas 'og nas 'byung ba ltar bya'o zhes pa ni man ngag go //
translated: thinking only of killing. If one asks, “Whom does one kill?” [one should kill] the wicked who harm the Three Jewels, and so on. If one asks, “If they become wicked, whom does one kill?” one should kill even Vajrasattva.

original: sangs rgyas sku gsum dam tshig ces pa ni sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku gsum dam tshig ces pa ni sbyor ba ste /
translated: The pledge of the three buddha bodies is the yoga.

original: de bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: One should protect that.

original: de lta bu'i rdo rje gsum gyi dkyil 'khor la gnas pas nyid ma bdun du byas na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rdo rje gsum gyi dkyil 'khor la gnas pas nyid ma bdun du byas na /
translated: If one who is situated in such a mandala of the three vajras performs the seven rites,

original: bsgrub bya bshig pa'i las byed pas na /
analyzed: bsgrub bya bshig pa'i las byed pas na /
translated: one performs the rite of destroying the victim.

original: sangs rgyas dngos grub ster bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dngos grub ster bar 'gyur //
translated: Thus, the buddhas will grant powers.

original: zhes so // las ma byas na bka' las 'das pas na rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // las ma byas na bka' las 'das pas na rmongs pa'o //
translated: If one does not perform the rite, one is confused because one has transgressed the command.

original: gzhan ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni go sla'o //
translated: The other [lines] are easy to understand.

original: rdo rje dam tshig ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dam tshig ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The vajra commitment is Akṣobhya.

original: de'i 'khor lo ni dkyil 'khor pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i 'khor lo ni dkyil 'khor pa rnams so //
translated: His wheel is the members of the mandala.

original: de rnams kyang ye shes par bka' stsal pa ni bka'i 'khor @66b lo ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyang ye shes par bka' stsal pa ni bka'i 'khor @66b lo ste /
translated: That wheel of the command is the command of the gnosis beings.

original: bsgrub bya'i rgyud la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i rgyud la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because they enter the continuum of the victim.

original: da ni ri mo'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i gsol ba gdab pa'i de ma thag tu lus ngag yid gsum gyi sbyor bas sa bzhi la gnas pa'i bgegs bskrad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni ri mo'i dkyil 'khor bri ba'i gsol ba gdab pa'i de ma thag tu lus ngag yid gsum gyi sbyor bas sa bzhi la gnas pa'i bgegs bskrad pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, immediately after the supplication to draw the maṇḍala, [the Bhagavān] declares the expulsion of the obstructors situated in the four directions by the yoga of body, speech, and mind:

original: nam mkha'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sky, etc.

original: 'khor lo rdo rje 'bar bas brgyan //
analyzed: 'khor lo rdo rje 'bar bas brgyan //
translated: The wheel is adorned with blazing vajras.

original: zhes pa ni ji skad gsungs pa'i gzhal yas khang du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gang gis kyang mi shigs pa rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni ji skad gsungs pa'i gzhal yas khang du dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo gang gis kyang mi shigs pa rnam par bsams la /
translated: Having visualized the mandala circle in the immeasurable mansion as stated, which is indestructible by anything,

original: de'i dbus su rnam pa'i mchog dang ldan pa'i rnam par snang mdzad ces pa ni rang rang gi sbyor ba dang mthun par mdzad pa ste rang gi lha'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su rnam pa'i mchog dang ldan pa'i rnam par snang mdzad ces pa ni rang rang gi sbyor ba dang mthun par mdzad pa ste rang gi lha'o //
translated: in its center, Vairochana endowed with the supreme of all aspects, is one's own deity, in accordance with one's application.

original: de yang dus gsum gyi dam tshig las byung ba ni rgyu rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: de yang dus gsum gyi dam tshig las byung ba ni rgyu rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: Moreover, arisen from the pledge of the three times, is the causal Vajrasattva.

original: de'i rgyur sngon du bsams nas zhes so //🔽dbyer mi phyed cing gdug pa rnams 'joms pas na /
analyzed: de'i rgyur sngon du bsams nas zhes so // dbyer mi phyed cing gdug pa rnams 'joms pas na /
translated: Having visualized that as the cause beforehand,🔽it is the vajra sparkler, blazing with light, because it is indivisible and destroys the wicked.

original: rdo rje me stag 'od 'phro ba can zhes te mtshan ma thams cad do //
analyzed: rdo rje me stag 'od 'phro ba can zhes te mtshan ma thams cad do //
translated: It is all the signs.

original: de'i phyag g-yas par bsnams par bsgom zhes so //
analyzed: de'i phyag g-yas par bsnams par bsgom zhes so //
translated: One should meditate on it held in one's right hand.

original: de nyid khro bo'i gzugs su mig dang rkang pa la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs nas so so'i spyod pa'i tshul khyad par gyis gar byed cing rdo rje dril bu dang ldan pas bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid khro bo'i gzugs su mig dang rkang pa la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs nas so so'i spyod pa'i tshul khyad par gyis gar byed cing rdo rje dril bu dang ldan pas bskor bar bya'o //
translated: Having blessed the eyes, feet, etc. of that very one in the form of a wrathful deity, one should circumambulate with the vajra and bell, dancing with the special manner of each deity.

original: dkyil 'khor sprul pa ni phyogs bcu zhes pa la sogs pa ste gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor sprul pa ni phyogs bcu zhes pa la sogs pa ste gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: Emanating the mandala is as above, beginning with “the ten directions. ”

original: lha'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i sku dang ye shes mchog la gnas pas bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: lha'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'i sku dang ye shes mchog la gnas pas bya'o zhes so //
translated: One should do it abiding in the supreme body and gnosis abiding in the nature of the deity.

original: lung gi ba sgo ba ni sku gsung zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lung gi ba sgo ba ni sku gsung zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The door of the scripture is “body, speech, ” etc.

original: g-yas brkyang ba la sogs pa'i tshul spyod pa ni sku'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang ba la sogs pa'i tshul spyod pa ni sku'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The practice of the manner of the right leg extended, etc. is the application of the body.

original: 'jig pa'i dus kyi 'brug lta bu'i h'um gi sgra sgrogs pa ni gsung gi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i dus kyi 'brug lta bu'i h'um gi sgra sgrogs pa ni gsung gi sbyor ba'o //
translated: The proclamation of the sound of HŪṀ like the thunder at the time of destruction is the application of speech.

original: dngos po thams cad zab mor dmigs pa ni thugs kyi sbyor ba'o //🔽de dang ldan pa'i bdag la gson //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad zab mor dmigs pa ni thugs kyi sbyor ba'o // de dang ldan pa'i bdag la gson //
translated: The observation of all things in the profound is the application of mind.

original: zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes sbyar ro //
translated: One should listen to me who possesses that.

original: de nas 'og nas 'byung ba'i rim pas phur bus btab nas sa bsrung bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de nas 'og nas 'byung ba'i rim pas phur bus btab nas sa bsrung bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: Then, having staked it with the stakes that will be described below, one should protect the ground.

original: bka' stsal pa'i 'khor los gzhan dam tshig 'da' mi nus pa'i ye shes rdo rje ste /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa'i 'khor los gzhan dam tshig 'da' mi nus pa'i ye shes rdo rje ste /
translated: The wheel that is spoken of is the vajra of gnosis, which cannot be transgressed by others.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That samādhi is called that.

original: gzhan ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The others are easy to understand, so they are not explained.

original: da ni gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor pas mngon spyod kyi cho ga bsam gtan las byung ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor pas mngon spyod kyi cho ga bsam gtan las byung ba gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the procedure of the rite of violence that arises from the yoga of the meditation of the practitioner of Yamāri is stated:

original: sangs rgyas zhes @67a * //🔽pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes @67a * // pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Buddha, etc.

original: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor 'khor lo can //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor 'khor lo can //
translated: The wheel of the maṇḍala of the Buddha

original: zhes pa ni gzhal yas khang pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzhal yas khang pa'o //
translated: is the celestial mansion.

original: de nam mkha'i rdo rje'i dbus su bsam zhes te chos kyi 'byung gnas su'o //
analyzed: de nam mkha'i rdo rje'i dbus su bsam zhes te chos kyi 'byung gnas su'o //
translated: One should imagine it in the middle of the vajra of space, that is, in the source of phenomena.

original: de'i dbus su gong ma ltar /
analyzed: de'i dbus su gong ma ltar /
translated: In the middle of that, as before,

original: gshin rje gshed kyi 'khor lo che //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed kyi 'khor lo che //
translated: is the great wheel of Yamāri.

original: zhes te / des gtso bo byas pa'i lha bcu dgu dang ldan pa'i 'khor lo bsgom ste de thams cad kyang gshin rje gshed las byung ba'i phyir na rang gi rdo rje yin par brtag ces so //
analyzed: zhes te / des gtso bo byas pa'i lha bcu dgu dang ldan pa'i 'khor lo bsgom ste de thams cad kyang gshin rje gshed las byung ba'i phyir na rang gi rdo rje yin par brtag ces so //
translated: Thus, having made that the principal one, one should meditate on the wheel endowed with the nineteen deities. Since all of them arise from Yamantaka, one should regard them as one's own vajra.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de yi dbus gnas gang yin pa //
analyzed: de yi dbus gnas gang yin pa //
translated: That which abides in its center

original: de yi 'khor lo de zhes bya //
analyzed: de yi 'khor lo de zhes bya //
translated: is called its wheel.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag po yi //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag po yi //
translated: The lord of the tathagatas

original: de gnas mi bskyed yang dag gnas //
analyzed: de gnas mi bskyed yang dag gnas //
translated: dwells there, unproduced, in reality.

original: zhes bzang po zhabs kyis bsdus don las bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bzang po zhabs kyis bsdus don las bshad do //
translated: This is explained in Subhagini's Summary.

original: dus gsum zhes pa la sogs pa ni mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i skabs bzhin du dpyad par bya ste go sla'o //
analyzed: dus gsum zhes pa la sogs pa ni mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i skabs bzhin du dpyad par bya ste go sla'o //
translated: The three times and so forth should be analyzed as in the context of the Akobhya yoga. It is easy to understand.

original: spyi'i dam tshig thams cad ni me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
analyzed: spyi'i dam tshig thams cad ni me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
translated: All general pledges are mirror-like pristine awareness.

original: de las byung ba ni sku gsum mnyam pa'i mchog ste rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni sku gsum mnyam pa'i mchog ste rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The supreme equality of the three bodies is Vairochana, who arises from that.

original: de'i rigs las skyes pa'i khro bo ni gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: de'i rigs las skyes pa'i khro bo ni gshin rje gshed do //
translated: The wrathful one born from his lineage is Yamantaka.

original: de'i sbyor bas gang la rgyas 'debs pa ni ye shes rdo rje zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i sbyor bas gang la rgyas 'debs pa ni ye shes rdo rje zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The one who is sealed by that yoga is called the “vajra of intuition.”

original: da ni tshogs sog pa'i rnal 'byor pas rdo rje'i sa gzhir skad cig gis 'khor bar byed pa'i 'khor lo khro bo bcu bsgom ste /
analyzed: da ni tshogs sog pa'i rnal 'byor pas rdo rje'i sa gzhir skad cig gis 'khor bar byed pa'i 'khor lo khro bo bcu bsgom ste /
translated: Now, the practitioner who is accumulating the stores should meditate on the ten wrathful ones who instantly create the wheel for wandering in cyclic existence on the vajra ground.

original: de'i lte ba la bsgom pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i lte ba la bsgom pa gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that one should meditate on them in the center.

original: sku gsung zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsung zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares “body, speech, and mind vajras,” etc.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje zhes pa ni rtag pa dang 'od dpag med dang mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje zhes pa ni rtag pa dang 'od dpag med dang mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The “body, speech, and mind vajras” are Akṣobhya, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi.

original: rang sngags don gyi yon tan ni stobs la sogs pa che ba'i yon tan ji snyed pa dang sems can gyi khams sna tshogs pa 'dul bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: rang sngags don gyi yon tan ni stobs la sogs pa che ba'i yon tan ji snyed pa dang sems can gyi khams sna tshogs pa 'dul bar byed pa ste /
translated: The “qualities of one’s own mantra” are the qualities of greatness such as the powers, and the taming of the various realms of sentient beings.

original: rin chen dbang phyug dang don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: rin chen dbang phyug dang don yod grub pa'o //
translated: They are Ratnasaṃbhava and Amoghasiddhi.

original: yang na gtsug tor dam tshig ces pa ni /
analyzed: yang na gtsug tor dam tshig ces pa ni /
translated: Alternatively, “uṣṇīṣa pledge”

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i gtsug tor bdun gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i gtsug tor bdun gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: means any of the seven uṣṇīṣas that will be described below.

original: de rnams kyang ye shes chen po dang ldan pas na ye shes rdo rje can gyi sku'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang ye shes chen po dang ldan pas na ye shes rdo rje can gyi sku'o //
translated: Since they are endowed with great pristine consciousness, they are the kāya of those with the vajra of pristine consciousness.

original: des sngags pa rnams bsrung ba'i phyir bka'i 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: des sngags pa rnams bsrung ba'i phyir bka'i 'khor lo ste /
translated: Since they protect the mantri/nis, they are the wheel of the command.

original: bka' stsal pas de'i las byed pa'i phyir na bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal pas de'i las byed pa'i phyir na bskul bar bya'o //
translated: Since they perform the function of the command, they are to be invoked.

original: byang chub bsrung ba don chen bya //
analyzed: byang chub bsrung ba don chen bya //
translated: The protection of awakening is the great purpose.

original: zhes pa ni rang la ye shes 'khor @67b lo 'jug par byed pa'i bgegs rnam pa gnyis bsal bas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang la ye shes 'khor @67b lo 'jug par byed pa'i bgegs rnam pa gnyis bsal bas /
translated: Since the two types of obstructors who cause the entry of the pristine consciousness wheel into oneself are removed,

original: gal te drag po la sogs pa'i bgegs kyi rgyu gang la yod pa de bsal yang /
analyzed: gal te drag po la sogs pa'i bgegs kyi rgyu gang la yod pa de bsal yang /
translated: if the obstructors of Rudra and so on are removed,

original: theg pa chung ngu'i bgegs ni thar pa chen po la sgrib par byed pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa chung ngu'i bgegs ni thar pa chen po la sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: the obstructors of the Hīnayāna are the obscurations to great liberation.

original: de yid la byed pas gzhan la blo mi 'jug pa ste /🔽sku skyed pa thams cad kyi dang por 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes so //
analyzed: de yid la byed pas gzhan la blo mi 'jug pa ste / sku skyed pa thams cad kyi dang por 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes so //
translated: Since one engages the mind in that, the mind does not engage elsewhere.

original: de rnams gnas gyur pa las dang po'i mgon po ste /
analyzed: de rnams gnas gyur pa las dang po'i mgon po ste /
translated: Since they are the first to generate the body, they are the first lords.

original: de las ji skad du gsungs pa'i chos rnams 'byung ba bskyed do zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de las ji skad du gsungs pa'i chos rnams 'byung ba bskyed do zhes sbyar ro //
translated: From that, the phenomena that are taught arise.

original: dam tshig gsum ni rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: dam tshig gsum ni rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: The three commitments are the three vajras.

original: mi phyed pas na rdo rje'o //🔽rtag pa las byung ba'i gzhal yas khang du gdan bsgom pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: mi phyed pas na rdo rje'o // rtag pa las byung ba'i gzhal yas khang du gdan bsgom pa gsungs pa /
translated: Since they are indivisible, they are vajras.

original: nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the seat in the celestial mansion that arises from permanence is stated by space, etc.

original: chos ni zhes pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i gzhal yas khang ngo //
analyzed: chos ni zhes pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i gzhal yas khang ngo //
translated: The dharma is the celestial mansion of pure mindfulness, etc.

original: de yang snang mdzad sku mchog las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de yang snang mdzad sku mchog las byung ba'o //
translated: That also arises from the supreme body of Vairocana.

original: de nyid rdo rje gsum gyi ngo bo las mi 'da' bas na sku gsum dam tshig dag bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje gsum gyi ngo bo las mi 'da' bas na sku gsum dam tshig dag bsam pa'o //
translated: Since that does not pass beyond the nature of the three vajras, it is the commitment of the three bodies.

original: de'i nang du gdan ni rab tu brtag / ces pa ni 'gro ba thams cad dbyer med par ston pa dang / de la skyon gyis ma gos pas na sna tshogs padma'i gdan bcu dgu'o //
analyzed: de'i nang du gdan ni rab tu brtag / ces pa ni 'gro ba thams cad dbyer med par ston pa dang / de la skyon gyis ma gos pas na sna tshogs padma'i gdan bcu dgu'o //
translated: One should imagine the seat in that, which shows that all migrating beings are indivisible, and since they are not sullied by faults, there are nineteen seats of various lotuses.

original: mi dge ba'i 'dam rdza ba skems pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i myu gu smin par byed pa'i phyir nyi ma'i gdan bdun no //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i 'dam rdza ba skems pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i myu gu smin par byed pa'i phyir nyi ma'i gdan bdun no //
translated: The seven sun seats are for drying up the mud of nonvirtue and for ripening the sprouts of the roots of virtue.

original: nyon mongs pa'i tsha ba bsil bar byed pa dang / byang chub kyi dge ba'i myu gu gso bar byed pa'i phyir zla ba'i gdan bcu gnyis kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i tsha ba bsil bar byed pa dang / byang chub kyi dge ba'i myu gu gso bar byed pa'i phyir zla ba'i gdan bcu gnyis kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: The twelve moon seats are for cooling the heat of the afflictions and for nourishing the sprouts of the virtue of enlightenment.

original: rdo rje sa bon dang ldan pa bsgom pa'i de ma thag tu spro bsdu dang ldan par nga rgyal ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje sa bon dang ldan pa bsgom pa'i de ma thag tu spro bsdu dang ldan par nga rgyal ba gsungs pa /
translated: Immediately after the meditation endowed with the vajra seed, the pride endowed with emanation and reabsorption is stated:

original: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the realm of space, etc.

original: de yang sa bon las 'phros pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mkha' dbyings yongs su gang bar bsgom mo //
analyzed: de yang sa bon las 'phros pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mkha' dbyings yongs su gang bar bsgom mo //
translated: Moreover, one should meditate on all the buddhas emanating from the seed and filling the realm of space.

original: rang sngags yi ge zhes pa ni rdo rje'i bum par chud pa'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: rang sngags yi ge zhes pa ni rdo rje'i bum par chud pa'i yi ge'o //
translated: One’s own mantra letter is the letter within the vajra vessel.

original: ye shes dam tshig ces pa ni ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de ltar bdag gis rang bzhin no zhes bsdu pa'i de ma thag tu ye shes kyi tshig brjod pa'o //🔽'phros pa des sems can thams cad kyang sangs rgyas nyid du byas nas byed pa po dang @68a * //
analyzed: ye shes dam tshig ces pa ni ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de ltar bdag gis rang bzhin no zhes bsdu pa'i de ma thag tu ye shes kyi tshig brjod pa'o // 'phros pa des sems can thams cad kyang sangs rgyas nyid du byas nas byed pa po dang @68a * //
translated: The words gnosis commitment are the words of gnosis immediately after the collection just as all the Tathagatas, so also I am the nature.

original: bcas par rab tu bsdu zhes so //
analyzed: bcas par rab tu bsdu zhes so //
translated: Having made all sentient beings into Buddhas with that emanation, the agent and the rest are completely collected.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: thugs kyi rdo rje yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: thugs kyi rdo rje yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of being the mind-vajra.

original: zhes te de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes te de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of arising from that.

original: sku gsum las ni zhes pa ni h'um la'o //
analyzed: sku gsum las ni zhes pa ni h'um la'o //
translated: From the three bodies is from the HŪṀ.

original: de dag gzud nas nga rgyal bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gzud nas nga rgyal bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Having inserted those, one should do the pride.

original: des ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyang bstan to //
analyzed: des ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyang bstan to //
translated: By that, the gnosis of purposeful activity is also taught.

original: sems can rnams kyis cho ga bzhi pa 'grub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis cho ga bzhi pa 'grub par byed pa'o //
translated: The sentient beings are the four-branched ritual.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang pa'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje ni rdo rje 'chang pa'o //
translated: Body, speech, and mind vajra is Vajradhara.

original: rdo rje ni rtse lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni rtse lnga pa'o //
translated: The vajra is the five-pointed one.

original: de'i sngags ni bum pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sngags ni bum pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: The mantra is the one abiding in the vase.

original: de nyid rin po che ste don 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid rin po che ste don 'byung ba'o //
translated: That is the jewel, the source of the meaning.

original: des gzhan gyi don rab tu snang bar byed pas na de skad do //
analyzed: des gzhan gyi don rab tu snang bar byed pas na de skad do //
translated: Since it illuminates the welfare of others, it is so called.

original: da ni zhi ba la gnas pa'i cho gas rdo rje rgya mtsho rkang pas bcag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni zhi ba la gnas pa'i cho gas rdo rje rgya mtsho rkang pas bcag pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the verse of Vajra Samudra is stated with the rite of remaining in peace:

original: rnam pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The verse begins with “aspect.”

original: rdo rje sems dpa' rab tu bsgom //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' rab tu bsgom //
translated: Meditate on Vajrasattva.

original: zhes pa ni sgrub pa chen po'i skabs su chung ngu'i rdul phra mo'i steng du bdag nyid bsgom mo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sgrub pa chen po'i skabs su chung ngu'i rdul phra mo'i steng du bdag nyid bsgom mo zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that in the context of great practice, one should meditate on oneself on the tip of a small particle.

original: chu nyid ji ltar bsam zhe na /
analyzed: chu nyid ji ltar bsam zhe na /
translated: How should one think of the water?

original: sangs rgyas rim par bkod nas ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rim par bkod nas ni //
translated: Having arranged the Buddhas in sequence,

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa las byung ba'i sa bon lnga las bde bar gshegs pa lnga ji lta ba bzhin du bkod nas bsnyen sgrub gsum gyis bsgrub par byas pa'i chu'i steng du bcag par bya zhes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa las byung ba'i sa bon lnga las bde bar gshegs pa lnga ji lta ba bzhin du bkod nas bsnyen sgrub gsum gyis bsgrub par byas pa'i chu'i steng du bcag par bya zhes so //
translated: This means that having arranged the five Sugatas just as they are from the five seed syllables arisen from the Vajra Holder, one should crush on the surface of the water that is accomplished by the three: approach, accomplishment, and great accomplishment.

original: ji ltar bcag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bcag par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one crush?

original: rkang pa mnyam gzhag sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rkang pa mnyam gzhag sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of equipoise of the feet,
